posts.name: Soham Ghosh
posts.cooked:
Hi @s.anand @carlton . My Quiz ID is Stockholm:100

in the Project 1 of TDS, the numerical answers from question 11 to question 15 are coming wrong. regardless of what I try. The other numerical answers are alright. Here is a picture for reference.

WhatsApp Image 2024-10-22 at 17.31.09_abe600461000×633 74.5 KB

what I have done with the questions is as follows:
11. binary encoded the columns has_projects and has_wiki then computed then correlation coefficient.
12. as given in the question, computed the average following for rows with hireable=true and subtracting from it, the average following of rest of the rows (ie. other than TRUE)
13. in this question, I have computed the regression slope of followers on bio_word count. I have also tried the correlation of length of their bio in unicode characters and followers. none are working.
15. again, like the question said, for hireable=TRUE i’m obtaining the fraction of users with email an then from it, subtracting fraction of users with email where hireable is not TRUE.

these were mostly done on excel. Could you please help me in understanding my faults? also please confirm if my understanding of the questions is correct.

would be thankful for any kind of help.

posts.name: Vikram Singh Negi
posts.cooked:
Similar thing is happening with me, Q11, 12, 13, and 15.

Even though my code logic seems sound.

posts.name: Bhavin
posts.cooked: Check your csv files have boolean values represented as true instead of TRUE\True and false instead of FALSE\False. The correct answers seem be calculated from our files in Github only (Assumably because of the dynamic nature of the data) so we need to follow the instructions exactly as given in the quiz. I was able to get these answers corrected after I reuploaded the csv files with these changes, barring #13.

There was an issue in backend which was fixed today as mentioned in the other thread by the TA. After that I was able to reach to the correct answer.

Regarding question 13 of project1 Tools in Data Science
The issues with incorrect answers for Project 1, Question 13 have been resolved. The backend script responsible for checking answers has been updated. Students can now answer Question 13 of the project1. Kind Regards

posts.name: Anand K
posts.cooked: I am still getting error in Q13.

posts.name: Bhavin
posts.cooked:
Which tool are you using? I used sklearn’s LinearRegression model to find out the regression slope.

Couple of points you can check are,

  1. You are counting words of the Bio by splitting it on whitespaces and not finding the length of the Bio.
  2. You are not considering the rows where Bio does not exist, just get rid of them from the calculation.

posts.name: Anand K
posts.cooked: I used both model sklearn.linear_model as well as satatsmodels.formula.api. In both models i am getting same answer, when i update and check answer, it says incorrect. i did word counting by bio splitting and had also eliminated all the rows which has no value.

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Sometimes students have done an incorrect split on a single whitespace. That WILL give you the wrong answer.

Eg.

This  is a bio.
This is a bio.

If you spilt on a single whitespace you will get 5 for the first one and 4 for the second one. Even though both should have resulted in 4 being the word count. This is a VERY common mistake. You have to treat all whitespace as a delimiter not individually.

Kind regards

posts.name: Anand K
posts.cooked: Thanks for the suggestion. I did amended my code to include multiple whitespaces use re. I got different answer, however, still my result shows incorrect.
